Developer Guides
For more information about using AdapterView, read the Binding to Data with AdapterView developer guide.

public virtual Android.Views.View EmptyView { get; set; }

Docs.summary: When the current adapter is empty, the AdapterView can display a special view called the empty view.

remarks.para:
Get method documentation [Android Documentation]
When the current adapter is empty, the AdapterView can display a special view called the empty view. The empty view is used to provide feedback to the user that no data is available in this AdapterView.

Set method documentation [Android Documentation]
Sets the view to show if the adapter is empty

Docs.summary: Returns the position within the adapter's data set for the first item displayed on screen.

remarks.para: Returns the position within the adapter's data set for the first item displayed on screen.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void OnLayout (bool changed, int left, int top, int right, int bottom);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnLayout(bool changed, int32 left, int32 top, int32 right, int32 bottom) cil managed

Docs.param: This is a new size or position for this view
Docs.summary: Called from layout when this view should assign a size and position to each of its children.

remarks.para:
Called from layout when this view should assign a size and position to each of its children.
Derived classes with children should override this method and call layout on each of their children.

The position of the view in the adapter.
The row id of the item that was clicked.
Docs.summary: Call the OnItemClickListener, if it is defined.

remarks.para: Call the OnItemClickListener, if it is defined. Performs all normal actions associated with clicking: reporting accessibility event, playing a sound, etc.

remarks.para: Sets the currently selected item. To support accessibility subclasses that override this method must invoke the overriden super method first.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
